work.summary: Mentor 4th-12th grade students in the development, design, and application of robotics through VEX.
highlights: Guide, mentor, and coach elementary to high school students in creating VEX and FRC competition robots.
Created and ran several lectures on the basics of RobotC programming for VEX.
Students are taught the basics of mechanical design, documentation, C-based programming, game strategy, project management, and teamwork.

work.summary: Research and analyze four existing blind star identification algorithms.
highlights: Implemented four different blind star identification methods, and proposed a fifth method.
Implemented a benchmark data generator in Python and C++.
Created and ran several experiments to test these identification methods.

work.company: University of Hawaii Information and Computer Sciences
work.summary: Manage lab machines for ICS department.
highlights: Helped managed four labs of computers, users and their networks.
Developed Powershell scripts to automate Active Directory user account renewal and additions.
Developed various batch scripts for unattended program installation and lab-wide application updates.

work.summary: Lead High level software student portions for NMSR and star tracker project.
highlights: Managed a Unix Gumstix device for a stationary payload on a sounding rocket.
Developed cross-platform memory/load/disk library for COSMOS project.
Developed visualization tools with QT C++ Framework.
Created COSMOS agents and libraries for star based attitude estimation, and IMU based attitude estimation.
